title: Platypuses Face a Dammed, Inbred Future
description: Stopping up rivers where platypuses reside is restricting the odd animalsâ€™ migration patterns and causing inbreeding, scientists say.
dc:creator: Nicholas Bakalar
media:credit: David Maurice Smith for The New York Times
media:description: Over two years, researchers examined platypus populations in five rivers with dams and four without in southeast Australia, collecting blood samples from 274 individuals to study their DNA.
